description: Denominator of the n-th alternating harmonic number, Sum_{k=1..n} (-1)^(k+1)/k.
comments: a(n) is a divisor of A003418(n). The first time this is a proper divisor, is a(15); see A269626. - _Jeppe Stig Nielsen_, Mar 01 2016
links: T. D. Noe and Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000 (1..200 from T. D. Noe)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Harmonic Number
formula: G.f. for A058313(n)/ A058312(n): log(1+x)/(1-x). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Jun 15 2003a(n) = n*a(n-1)/gcd(n*a(n-1), n*A05813(n-1)+(-1)^(n-1)*a(n-1)). - _Robert Israel_, Jul 05 2015
maple: A058313 := n->denom(add((-1)^(k+1)/k,k=1..n));# Alternatively:a := n -> denom(harmonic(n) - harmonic((n-modp(n,2))/2)):seq(a(n), n=1..28); # _Peter Luschny_, May 03 2016
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[(-1)^(k+1)/k, {k, 1, n}]; Table[a[n] // Denominator, {n, 1, 30}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, May 26 2015 *)a[n_]:= (-1)^n(HarmonicNumber[n/2-1/2]-HarmonicNumber[n/2]+(-1)^n Log[4])/2; Table[a[n] // FullSimplify, {n, 1, 29}] // Denominator (* _Gerry Martens_, Jul 05 2015 *)Rest[Denominator[CoefficientList[Series[Log[1 + x]/(1 - x),{x, 0, 33}], x]]] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 06 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n)=denominator(polcoeff(-log(1-x)/(x+1)+O(x^(n+1)),n))(PARI) a(n)=denominator(sum(k=1,n,(-1)^(k+1)/k)) \\ _Jeppe Stig Nielsen_, Mar 01 2016(Haskell)import Data.Ratio((%), denominator)a058312 n = a058312_list !! (n-1)a058312_list = map denominator $ scanl1 (+) $                   map (1 %) $ tail a181983_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 20 2013
crossrefs: Cf. A002805 (denominator of n-th harmonic number).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 09 2000
